CatDescriptText: Don Pearson, sales department employe [sic], Bellevue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 10, 1962, pg. 11 with question: "Do you think a shorter work week is the answer to the job loss posed by automation?"  Answer reads: "If we are going to out produce Kruschchev, we can't do it on a 20 or 32 hour work basis regardless of the objective that the proponents of the shorter work week are seeking."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Don Pearson wearing fedora with dark band and light colored overcoat, posed in front of C.A. Michael store, Smithfield Street, Downtown
